modify_suggestions: As a local resident living close to the Uniting Church, I feel strongly that the building should maintain its original function as a place of worship for the local community. However, I am also encouraged that the "church community" recognises the need to focus on the future for their building. It is a fundamental feature in the wider concept  of the Garden Quarter, writ large, and it is essential that it be developed in a manner that ensures it will continue as a dynamic hub for the wider community. That would secure both the future of the building and secure its role as a place of welcome, worship and community participation, involving as many folk as possible across all age ranges.

activities_like_to_see: Drama;Photography;Creative workshops;Arts exhibitions;Live music;Music / singing classes;Community cafe;Community coffee mornings;Pop-up fruit and veg weekly market;Community social events;After school club;Activities for children;Fitness / yoga / pilates / dance classes;Community book club;
usage_suggestions:
Space where young people in the community can have their own clubs to reflect their interests, and be supported by adults and an infrastructure (ie. Use of building, featured in any timetable/brochure of events, refreshments, help setting up and cleaning away) to meet safely whilst taking a lead and ownership of their club. (Eg. A weekly slot where a kid can advertise a Club on their choosing, e.g Lego Club,  that would last for say, ten weeks. Before it starts they could be supported to plan the 10 weeks (eg. weekly build themes, practicalities such as where to source bricks). 

Programmed events would be amazing, such a concerts of local performers (e.g. Chester uni music department, chamber music, local acoustic performers, bands), poetry readings, choirs etc. It would be great for this to be inclusive of music and literature from people from the diverse range of ethnic backgrounds in the area.

Community ceilidhs!
modify_suggestions: This would be amazing for the Garden Quarter. It is hard to meet people locally and as a parent with young kids, the only place to meet up are local parks which are time limited due to lack of public toilet facilities and are also weather dependent. It would be great to have a programme of regular community and cultural events to help deliver and enjoy - it would make the community more cohesive and help balance out some of the transient nature of the local community due to high student population. Strong communities are vital to wellbeing but it is hard to build community without a shared space to meet.
contribute: YES -¬† I would be interested in becoming a volunteer

activities_like_to_see: Live music;Live theatre;

Drama;Creative workshops;Arts exhibitions;Live music;Music / singing classes;Live theatre;Community cafe;Community coffee mornings;Community cinema;Pop-up fruit and veg weekly market;A place to worship;Community social events;Activities for young people;Fitness / yoga / pilates / dance classes;Community book club;
modify_suggestions:
I think this building has been used as a multi purpose space very successfully for a number of years . Myself and my family have attended events such as worship , drama club , yoga , cinema , children‚Äôs activities , wildlife workshops , theatre productions , arts initiatives there . This shows there is a need for this type of facility in our community and that the space is very important for the community . It used to be that the church provided for the community‚Äôs needs week in week out - with three well attended services each Sunday providing a focal point for community gatherings, spiritual and moral well being and support . Society has shifted and although people still have the same needs for community , togetherness, music , warmth and support people no longer find this on a Sunday in a formal church service In the numbers they used to . So a wider variety of activities are needed to make sure people‚Äôs mental health and need for community is met - particularly given the huge chasms of inequality and mental health issues which are now more prevalent in our country than ever. Both of these issues have community disconnection and alienation at their heart . The govt is providing less and less as the state shrinks back - and this requires individuals  and communities to step up to look after ourselves . We need spaces to do this . The community NEEDS this space as a hub and it would Be a Devastating loss if the Community could no longer use it .

 I don‚Äôt particularly have a vision for how the building needs to change physically to allow this development but would be really interested to see others ideas to inspire me . Whatever changes take place we should respect the original sacred nature of the space As much as possible whilst also allowing its future multi purpose development . It is possible and important to do both . The chapel has a wonderful atmosphere of inclusivity that has community at its heart which can be celebrated and extended so everyone can feel the special nature of this space in a way they is supportive and meaningful to them personally . 

Many thanks to all those leading on this project it is very important .
contribute: YES -¬† I would be interested in becoming a volunteer

activities_like_to_see: Community book club;Fitness / yoga / pilates / dance classes;Activities for seniors;Activities for young people;Activities for children;After school club;A toddler group;Community social events;A place to worship;Community cookery;Pop-up fruit and veg weekly market;Counselling / wellbeing services;Community cinema;Community coffee mornings;Community cafe;Live theatre;Live music;Music / singing classes;Creative writing;Arts exhibitions;Photography;Creative workshops;Drama;
usage_suggestions: One of the things I‚Äôve really missed is the Garden Lane Festival. Pre-Covid this event was one that we really enjoyed. Felt like a community or businesses abs residents of all ages just spending time together and celebrating our little patch of Chester with music, crafts, yoga, food and drink. I‚Äôd love to see it come back. Maybe this building can help facilitate planning to bring this back
modify_suggestions: I love this community. Any opportunities to bring us all together are welcome. The new coffee shops are great and give us new places to meet. Engaging with the local businesses to support the building as a community hub would be good.

activities_like_to_see: Drama;Photography;Live music;Arts exhibitions;Music / singing classes;Live theatre;Community cafe;Community coffee mornings;Community cinema;Counselling / wellbeing services;Pop-up fruit and veg weekly market;Community social events;Community cookery;After school club;Activities for children;Activities for young people;
modify_suggestions:
I‚Äôm not a religious person but I think it‚Äôs important to respect the feelings of those who still use the building for its original purpose. I also think the integrity of the buildings structure should be kept, as much as is possible, in tact, as these old chapels and their contents are disappearing fast. 
Having said that, if making sympathetic changes to the building allows it to continue and develop as a community asset, then I would support that.

usage_suggestions: This could be made into a true community hub. It could open up to Volunteers and encourage entrepreneurship, for local trade to exhibit and sell. The opportunities are endless and I would very much like to see this happen.

modify_suggestions: Post pandemic, a number of meeting places/spaces have ceased to operate which has impacted on many groups. An example would be the mental health charity Chapter who have a number of projects they'd like to operate in Chester but struggle fo a venue. The Uniting Church is an ideal space for a range of activities, well located and benefitting from the solid community spirit surrounding it. The word "hub" is tossed around fairly liberally but, in this instance, I feel that the church could be a vibrant and energizing centre for all that the area, and beyond, has to offer.

usage_suggestions: I was neutral on question 9 because whilst I really believe that this should be the heart of Christian worship in the community I  don't think this has to be a traditional service on a Sunday. Can we be creative at other times in the week?

activities_like_to_see: Drama;Photography;Creative workshops;Arts exhibitions;Creative writing;Live music;Music / singing classes;Live theatre;Community cafe;Community cinema;Counselling / wellbeing services;Pop-up fruit and veg weekly market;Community cookery;Fitness / yoga / pilates / dance classes;
usage_suggestions: I‚Äôm not of any faith but don‚Äôt have an issue if the space is used for faith activities. It would be great to see the space open for different faiths if people requested
modify_suggestions:
A community hub space is a massive asset for the community and does so much to improve inclusivity and avoid social isolation.. I‚Äôve seen this in other areas such as Hoole. Having kitchen facilities and/or a cafe greatly improves the potential for functions and gatherings. Having as large a function space as possible, with scope to zone the space into smaller areas (eg screens or accordion style doors) means it is much more adaptable esp with social distancing or sessions involving movement etc. I would love to have a semi regular market or a fix it group or leisure groups running from this space. A cafe that has a free play area would be an easy place for me to meet friends who are parents. Maybe the cafe could be run as a social enterprise ? 
It would be great to still use the space for community activities such as meetings and consultations with the council, drop off for the food bank etc. Car parking would need to be taken into account. 
I would welcome opportunity to hire the space for occasional classes I run or for music rehearsal space. Look forward for hearing how this progresses and how community members might be able to help with fundraising or helping to build up this new asset.
contribute: YES -¬† I would be interested in becoming a volunteer

usage_suggestions: You had a choir over from Wrexham about 4 years ago? That was really good. Nice to be able to walk to something and not have to get busses or taxis. Cinema in the Lane was good too, particularly in the winter when you don't feel like going far. Maybe a first aid course (basic). A little knowledge gives people the confidence to step in and help if needed instead of panicking or walking past doing nothing.
modify_suggestions:
Soup and Pudding again.
Some originality for the building should be maintained.
I think we have enough cafes / eateries in the Lane.

Whilst some cosmetic work may be necessary or structural maintenance for safety, I feel the original building and organ etc should be kept as much as possible to the original structure. A traditional look is more in keeping with the surrounding area, particularly Cambrian Road.
